name: Slieve Donard Resort and Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: the rooms were not that nice
reviews.title: shocking!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the staff were extremely rude
reviews.title: Superb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the food was nothing special
reviews.title: great friendly hotel
Ohhhh I just love this place - returned visit excelled on my previous visit
reviews.text: the pool and spa was about the only good thing in this hotel

reviews.title: Lovely old hotel
reviews.text: The worst was definitely the rudeness and the cheek we got from the staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very good location(mountains of mourne) and sea views(100'),a resort hotel with golf/spa-swimming pool.Beautiful rooms,excellent food--Irish hostipality at its best.Great historic hotel on the edge of the sea and the nice small town of Newcastle.Staff were very good,stayed on a Shearings coach tour of Ireland and they were great with us!
reviews.title: could have stayed more than 2 nights

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although we weren't staying there, stopping at the Slieve Donard merely for a cup of coffee during an afternoon drive along the Mourne Coastal route, on asking for recommendations as to local sights, we were so impressed by the professionalism and friendliness of reception staff we decided to come back for dinner later in the Oak Room. With it's old fashioned and very comfortable decor, brightened by the light from the sea, here too, the staff were efficient and friendly, serving speedily but giving diners no sense of being rushed - and never overdoing that “is everything all right?" thing which can sometimes be irritating. All meats, fish and produce on the menu enumerated local suppliers, and while not cheap, the food was good enough to be worth what was charged. We've decided to go back to stay for a few days later in the year.. Deirdre Purcell and Kevin Healy, Co Meath.
reviews.title: This famous old hotel - the Slieve Donard - lives up to expectations.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Slieve Donard from 31/05/13 - 02/06/13. Room was great, though I paid for an upgrade. Two Weddings on over the weekend which can be an issue in some hotels but we never noticed them.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The food and service was excellent, especially our wine waiter, very personable - although I thought the wine was a little expensive.
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: The facilities, gym and spa, are great and very clean. The girlfriend was very pleased with spa treatments she charged to my credit card as well!
reviews.title: Lovely hotel and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: wow from the moment we drove up to the sileve donard it was breath taking, the grandure of the place and the view from the hotel was amazing! walking into the hotel, with the log fire was lovely, the staff were lovely and very helpful and professional. We got to the room and it was gorge with a partial sea view.
reviews.title: Princess style treatment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009
reviews.text: During the evening of our stay we tried out the spa, as well as in the morning, its more amazing in morning time because you can sit in the jacuzzi and look out at the mournes and sea...awesome!
reviews.title: fabulous for a romantic break

likes.liked: — attention to detail, frsh milk available on request for tea/coffee in your room!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff and hotel made you feel so special, would have loved to stay later!
reviews.title: Great Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was lovely, wide variety and could have ate for hours!!
reviews.title: Failed to live up to its potential

likes.disliked: — The room, the decor in parts, the buffet dinner

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A must go for a special break with partners, girls weekend or with family & kids.
reviews.title: Perfect short break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked a one night stay with dinner and breakfast for my boyfriend's 22nd birthday. From the moment we arrived, it was bliss. We made full use of the spa facilities at 12, which is a great way to pass the time until check in at 3. The shampoo/conditioner facilities are fantastic luxury products and the towels are soft. I highly recommend booking an executive room, as the use of the dressing gowns are free and the bay windows offer a fantastic view. Our room had a view of both the sea and mountains. We had breakfast in the room which was great! The staff are friendly and accommodating. I recommend tipping the bar staff in the Chaplin bar for their cocktails as they don't get many and they are fantastic! Perfect trip.
reviews.title: What an experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: this is the 2nd time Ive been disappointed with the food in this hotel and this mornings breakfast was really cold.The only thing warm was my toast. I did not expect to be whaowed however did expect to enjoy the food. . Stunning views and hotel are outstanding but it is let down by the basics. When checking out I was not asked if everything was ok but made it a point to advise that the room needed to be cleaned before they put anymore guests into it. The windows were dirty and had cobwebs, nor had the bin been emptied before we were given the room. Sorry but I dont think I'll be back
reviews.title: not all its supposed to be

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: My daughter's wedding was held here, ceremony, reception and party after. All was conducted with efficiency and expertise by the staff, and special mention to Chris, who organised everything superbly. The event was held in the Chandelier Room, which has huge bay windows with views of the mountains. The photographs outside had the beach and the sea and the mountains for a backdrop, which was wonderful.
reviews.title: Wonderful location for my daughter's wedding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel itself is very impressive and beautifully decorated, which was important to us, as we had guests from the UK mainland, Europe, Australia and America.
reviews.title: Best Ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are spacious and clean, and you can request a sea view, though this is not always available.
reviews.title: Great hotel, in a beautiful location, near Royal County Down

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013
reviews.text: As we booked in they told us our room was not ready as they had upgraded us to a superior sea view room, so we went for a roam happy! When we returned we didn't have a sea view room & they said they had non vacant!!! They offered to send up our luggage then forgot so I had to go get it myself. That said it is a lively, grand, spotless hotel and the rooms are lovely. Breakfast is self serve and a little dried up!!.... All in all though fab stay!
reviews.title: Gorgeous hotel, top location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: Since last visit in 2010 much of the public areas including the bar have been decorated - the horrible carpet has gone and it all looks much better than before. The bar is fine - the atmosphere is still somewhat stilted. Additionally, some sort of irritating deal has obviously been struck with the drinks companies, so that various beers such as Guinness are not available at all in the hotel.
reviews.title: Improving....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms in the new wing remain beautiful as is the spa.
reviews.title: luxuy at a great price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food at breakfast and dinner in the restaurant also has improved, although remains patchy in quality.
reviews.title: Splendid Setting where the Mourne Mountains meet the Sea.
Kat27
reviews.text: stayed here a number of times and never been disappointed.Beautiful hotel in a superb location. Had dinner in the Percy French Restaurant, great food and with the mid week 'sizzle and sip' offer at £15 for 2 courses and a glass of wine a real bargain. You can upgrade to a full bottle of wine for £5. The spa and fitness facilities are excellent. We will be back time and time again!!!! Well done Sleive Donard

reviews.title: BITTER SWEET
reviews.text: My husband and I booked a 2 night stay in the Slieve Donard Hotel, Newcastle 17/18 May in a superior sea view room. We were shown to our room which the receptionist described as a beautiful room. Yes there was a partial view of the sea and the side window overlooked garages/ bin area. There was no bath just a shower. I phoned reception to ask if we could move to a room with a bath but this was not possible or so I was told. The receptionist said I had not requested a bath!!!!!!! Our meal in the Oak restaurant on the Friday evening was of poor quality - the chicken masala fell short of the description on the menu - chunky chicken in a creamy masala sauce. It was a tired looking chicken breast with a blob of sauce (a bought in sauce) I suspect. The breakfast was the usual pre cooked items being kept warm in containers. We returned to our room on Saturday at 2.30 pm to have a rest and it still had not been made up since the morning. There was nowhere quiet to sit and read. There were 2 wedding receptions on and literally everywhere was noisy - the drawing room was occupied with wedding guests on mobile phones. I spoke to the duty manager Colleen? who while understanding didn't really do anything other than undertake to pass on my comments. She showed me another room which had a bath but was a long narrow room with sloping ceilings - we decided to stay in room 300. All in all not a relaxing stay and we will certainly not be returning to the Slieve Donard. On the positive side I left my engagement ring in the room and they very kindly posted it to me free of charge which I so much appreciated.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012
reviews.text: Stayed in this hotel for two nights as I got a good deal. The location is very nice and has lovely views of the ocean and mourne mountains. The room itself had everything that you would expect except the wifi is £10 for 24 hrs which in the 21sr century I would expect for free while staying in a hotel. The breakfast was very nice with full cooked buffet and cold meat/fruit buffet
reviews.title: Hidden gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would and will stay again
reviews.title: Wedding Venue and Amazing Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I got married here on 24th May 2013 and it was just amazing. The venue was spectacular and the staff were fantastic. From the moment of booking getting details arranged was easy considering my fiancé and I are living in Canada at the moment. The staff were great, Laura dealt with all our arrangements until the week before and then Chris looked after the final details and the event on the day.
reviews.title: Fabulous Location, Lovely Bank Holiday Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013
reviews.text: Chris ran everything seamlessly and the wedding ran without a hitch.
reviews.title: Beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Firstly the good parts, the room we stayed in (resort double) was beautiful with beautiful views of the sea and snow capped mountains. The Hotel is very impressive in its sheer size and scale. The Spa is terrific, we even had special treatments upstairs and you can tell this has had loads of money thrown at it, its quite something! Unfortunately the hotel has drawbacks, the food and drink is an absolute rip-off. 2 x sandwiches and 2 x coffees were £23 in the Lighthouse Lounge. A pint of Cider was around £3.60. Percy Frenchs had zero atmosphere, distinctly average food and was pretty extortionate and the staff were just average with a large amount appearing to be teenagers on a sturday job who couldn't be bothered being there. Despite the drawbacks I would still go again, if Hastings could just get its act together on these aspects the place would be an absolute cracker.......here's hoping!!!
reviews.title: Could be better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: I heard so many rave reviews about Slieve Donard I have been wanting to go for the last 3 /4 years so just back today and this is my honest opinion - very disappointed, okay so location & this beautiful majestic building are second to none ...BUT over priced and nothing to write home about.
reviews.title: Not what I expected - Northern Irelands number 1 hotel??!!

likes.disliked: — a bit of a rip-off everything expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room which was supposed to be a superior family room was just average but the beds were extremely comfy (walls very thin could hear a couple upstairs & there creaking bed til the wee hours).
reviews.title: Loved it all!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Never ate in restaurant .. soooo expensive £40 per person so for 2 of us and a child wud have been £100 excluding wine & drinks - c'mon were in a recession here so we found a lovely italian just 5 mins walk away which was packed both nights we ate there & the food was gorgeous and very reasonable (other like minded guests also ate there rather than the hotel - they are losing lots of custom because of this).
reviews.title: Wedding Conveyor Belt

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Money mad hotel had to pay £5 each for bath-robes.
reviews.title: Gorgeous for a Spa Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009
reviews.text: As you drive up towards the hotel the impressive old building does give you that 'wow' factor. it is set in its own impressive grounds and right by the irish sea. The room that we were allocated was number 302. It had amazing views of both the Mourne Mountains and the Irish Sea. the room was quite modern and very clean. My only gripe with this hotel is the standard and cost of the dinner. For £40 pp the meal was not up to the expected standard and the set munu definately needs 'up dating' . However the hotl provides guests with free use of their amazing spa facilities and this alone makes for an amazing expaerience.
reviews.title: not what i imagined

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all it was quite a nice break but at quite a cost.
reviews.title: lovely hotel and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: just back from a two night stay at this hotel. Had a front corner room overlooking the mountains and sea. A sea view was requested at time of booking. Nice, clean and no complaints.
reviews.title: Great spa, hotel's only so so..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The spa was lovely but the relaxation factor was somewhat ruined by screaming kids, at some stages it was more like the pool in Trabolgan. I didn't know kids were a feature of supposedly luxury spas. Although there are signs for example saying the vitality pool was only for adults, this was't being adhered to or enforced.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprising and most relaxing stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: no complaints with the staff like previous posters not that i had much interaction with them but when i did they were pleasant and efficient.
reviews.title: A place that's just that goes that extra mile!

description: Nestling at the foot of the Mourne Mountains, the Slieve Donard stands in six acres of private grounds, and is one of Northern Ireland's most popular hotels. The luxurious ESPA Spa commands spectacular panoramic views of the County Down coastline and Mountains of Mourne and provides a perfect oasis of tranquility rivals any spa in Europe today. This superbly maintained Victorian hotel is equally suited to a short break, residential conference or grand event.
